nodes.bodyText:
@jcesarmobile I noticed the no-irregular-whitespace rule triggered for this space. Was it intentional to not use a normal space here?
I believe this change will have downstream effects when the podfile is regenerated in users' apps. (They'll see a git difference, which is probably fine.)
I don't think it was intentional nor know how to create an "irregular" whitespace, but does the replace still work if you change it?
Since it's next to the # I guess I pressed the space bar while still holding alt key when I added that line in the Podfile, and then I copied from the Podfile to the update.ts
@jcesarmobile Here's what I ended up doing. Now it replaces the content of the entire block. I think this is okay?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -96,8 +96,8 @@ export async function updatePodfile(
   const podfileLockPath = join(projectRoot, 'Podfile.lock');
   let podfileContent = await readFileAsync(podfilePath, 'utf8');
   podfileContent = podfileContent.replace(
-    /(Automatic Capacitor Pod dependencies, do not delete)[\s\S]*(# Do not delete)/,
-    '$1' + dependenciesContent + '\n  $2',
+    /(def capacitor_pods)[\s\S]+?(\nend)/,
+    `$1\n  # Autogenerated by Capacitor--DO NOT DELETE${dependenciesContent}\n  # DO NOT DELETE$2`,
